etymology.description: 水 (“water”) + 少 (“to lack; to be short of”).
etymology.interpretation: Combines “water” with “few/less” to suggest a place where water is scant, such as shallow edges or dried areas where grit remains. By extension it came to denote the fine granular material known as sand.

examples.chinese: 沙漠很广阔(沙漠很廣闊)。
海风把沙吹得到处都是(海風把沙吹得到處都是)。
examples.pinyin: Hǎifēng bǎ shā chuī de dàochù dōu shì.
examples.english: The sea breeze blew sand everywhere.

examples.chinese: 小孩在沙滩上堆城堡(小孩在沙灘上堆城堡)。
examples.pinyin: Xiǎohái zài shātān shàng duī chéngbǎo.
examples.english: Children build sandcastles on the beach.
